TopicTitle: A question about the GNU - General Public License v 3

Articles.Content:
I have a quick question. One of my favorite mods is no loner being managed by its author. It uses the GNU GPL v3 and I need some clarification.

Am I free to update the mod as long as I acknowledge their original work and contribution? If not, can I construct a parallel mod that will do the same thing without running into trouble?

I have tried to contact iPeer through the forum AND through PasteBin to no avail - and even subscribed to PasteBin just to make contact. Any advice would be great.

18 minutes ago, adsii1970 said:

I have a quick question. One of my favorite mods is no loner being managed by its author. It uses the GNU GPL v3 and I need some clarification.

Am I free to update the mod as long as I acknowledge their original work and contribution? If not, can I construct a parallel mod that will do the same thing without running into trouble?

I have tried to contact iPeer through the forum AND through PasteBin to no avail - and even subscribed to PasteBin just to make contact. Any advice would be great.

You can do as you wish with the mod as long as you include the same license with your version and I assume you will attribute the original as well.  That's all you will need to do.

Just now, Galileo said:

Thanks. I was pretty sure that is what I was reading but I just wanted a second opinion.
